title: Quiz 8: Community Health Nursing - January 2020 FQE (Part 2)
description: Part 2 of the January 2020 Final Qualifying Examination, covering Short Answer and Long Answer Questions on Cold Chain, Waste Management, Ethics, and Yellow Fever.

questions.question: Outline the factors you would consider when designing a questionnaire for community diagnosis: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Questionnaires should be clear, relevant, logical, and in a language the community understands.

questions.question: Identify equipment used for monitoring Cold Chain temperatures: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Temperature monitoring relies on VVMs, Fridge Tags, Thermometers, and Freeze Tags.

questions.question: Which types of waste can negatively affect the environment? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: All listed types (Solid, Liquid, Clinical, Chemical, E-waste) pose environmental hazards.

questions.question: What ethical considerations must be ensured before conducting a community diagnosis? (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Research ethics require consent, confidentiality, doing good, avoiding harm, and justice.

questions.question: Select the benefits of contraceptive implants: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Implants are LARC methods that are effective, reversible, and estrogen-free, but do not prevent STIs.

questions.question: Arrange the phases of the Project Life Cycle in order:
questions.explanation: Cycle: Initiation -> Planning -> Execution -> Monitoring -> Closure.
questions.hint: Start to Finish of a project.

questions.question: Identify propositions of Role Theory: (Select all that apply)
questions.explanation: Role theory involves expectations, conflict, ambiguity, strain, and overload.

questions.question: Services available for older persons in Kenya include: (Select all that apply)

options.text: Priority Service Delivery in public institutions

questions.explanation: Kenya provides cash transfers, NHIF subsidy, and priority services for the elderly.

questions.question: Regarding Yellow Fever (Scenario: Iwenzo facility outbreak): (Select all that apply)

options.text: It is transmitted by Aedes mosquitoes
Signs include Fever, Jaundice, and Hemorrhage
Transmission cycles are Sylvatic, Intermediate, and Urban
Preventive measures include Vaccination (1 dose lifetime) and Vector Control
Treatment involves a specific antiviral drug

questions.explanation: Yellow Fever management focuses on prevention (vaccine/vector control) and supportive care; there is no specific antiviral treatment.
